intro: Calampelis, commonly known as the goldenstar bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. Calampelis species are typically perennial herbs with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens due to their vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
